reasons_to_visit.details: March marks the arrival of spring in Lisbon, with increasingly sunny days, milder temperatures (avg. 17°C high), and the city starting to bloom, making it ideal for exploring before summer crowds.
Enjoy Lisbon's major attractions like São Jorge Castle, Belém Tower, and museums with significantly fewer tourists than in peak season, allowing for a more relaxed experience.
Benefit from shoulder season pricing for flights and accommodation, offering better value compared to the summer months.
Parts of the city and surrounding areas burst with yellow mimosa blossoms, adding vibrant color to the landscape, particularly noticeable on sunny days.
The improving weather makes it pleasant for walking tours, exploring Alfama's streets, enjoying viewpoints (miradouros), and potentially the first comfortable outdoor cafe sessions.
March often hosts film festivals (like Monstra - Lisbon Animation Festival) and other cultural events as the city emerges from winter.
Weather becomes more suitable for day trips to Sintra, Cascais, or Óbidos, with fewer crowds than in summer.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March weather can be changeable. While often pleasant, expect potential rain showers and occasional windy days. Pack accordingly.
Despite warmer days, evenings can still be quite cool (avg. low 9°C), requiring jackets or sweaters, especially near the river.
While some flowers bloom, it's not the peak season for jacarandas or other famous floral displays seen later in spring.
If Easter falls in late March, expect a significant increase in visitors, higher accommodation prices, and potential closures on Good Friday and Easter Sunday.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain, averaging around 60-80mm spread over 10-12 days. Mix of sunny periods and showery days.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers including sweaters and a waterproof/windproof jacket. Comfortable walking shoes are essential. An umbrella is recommended.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to moderate. Attractions are easily accessible without long waits.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season rates, good value for accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Calm and pleasant. City feels local, gradually transitioning towards spring.

events_holidays.name: Monstra - Lisbon Animation Festival
events_holidays.description: International animation festival showcasing a wide range of animated films, workshops, and exhibitions across various city venues.
events_holidays.notes: Tickets required for screenings/workshops. Attracts animation enthusiasts and professionals.

events_holidays.name: St. Patrick's Day Celebrations
events_holidays.description: While not a Portuguese holiday, many Irish pubs and some other bars in Lisbon host St. Patrick's Day events with live music and special promotions.
events_holidays.notes: Concentrated in specific pubs, particularly in the Cais do Sodré area. Can be lively but localized.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic Alfama district and visit São Jorge Castle with fewer crowds and pleasant temperatures for climbing the hills.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Enjoy getting lost in the narrow streets. Castle offers great views, potentially clearer in spring air.

unique_experiences.description: Discover the history of Portuguese tiles in a beautiful former convent. An excellent choice for a potentially rainy day.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Accessible by bus. Allow 1.5-2 hours. Features a stunning chapel inside.

unique_experiences.description: Take the iconic yellow tram through Lisbon's neighbourhoods. Less crowded than summer, offering better views.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Still advisable to be mindful of belongings. Use Viva Viagem card for cheaper fares.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy a Bica at a Viewpoint
unique_experiences.where: Various Miradouros (e.g., Portas do Sol, Graça)
unique_experiences.description: Grab an espresso (bica) from a kiosk at one of Lisbon's viewpoints and enjoy the scenery as the weather starts to warm up.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Viewpoints can be breezy, bring a jacket. Kiosks offer simple drinks and snacks.

weather.precipitation: Chance of rain decreases slightly, with more frequent sunny spells. Days feel noticeably longer and warmer.
weather.general_tips: Continue layering, but lighter options might suffice on warmer days. Sunscreen becoming more important on sunny days.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, increasing significantly if Easter falls in this period.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season rates, but expect sharp increases around Easter if applicable.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Spring is more evident. Outdoor cafes become busier. Increased activity if coinciding with Easter preparations.

events_holidays.name: Easter Week (Semana Santa) Activities (if applicable)
events_holidays.description: If Easter falls late March, expect religious processions (though less elaborate than Spain), special church services, and traditional Easter foods like Folar da Páscoa (sweet bread) appearing in bakeries.
events_holidays.notes: Good Friday and Easter Sunday can see some closures. Increased visitor numbers and higher prices likely.

events_holidays.name: Lisbon Half Marathon (Meia Maratona de Lisboa)
events_holidays.description: Major international running event, often crossing the 25 de Abril Bridge, attracting thousands of participants and spectators.
events_holidays.notes: Significant road closures in certain areas on race day. Lively atmosphere along the course.

unique_experiences.description: Visit the fairytale palaces and castles of Sintra as the weather becomes more reliable and gardens start showing more spring color.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Take the train from Rossio. Still fewer crowds than summer, but Easter week can be busy. Book popular palace tickets online.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the stunning monastery and other Belém landmarks with manageable crowds (unless it's Easter week).
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening times. Combine with Pastéis de Belém. Pleasant for walking along the waterfront on a nice day.

unique_experiences.description: Browse the independent shops, restaurants, and art spaces in this trendy converted industrial complex.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Good spot for lunch or afternoon coffee. Sunday market is popular. Easily accessible by Tram 15.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a walk or bike ride along the renovated riverfront areas as the weather improves, taking in views of the bridge and city.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Flat and accessible. Can be breezy. Rent bikes near Cais do Sodré or Praça do Comércio.
